contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox German district| name=Freising| state=Bavaria| capital=[[Freising]]| regierungsbezirk=[[Oberbayern]]| region=Munich| area=800|Kreisschlüssel = 09178 | population=155,396| density=190| carsign=FS| url=[http://www.lra-freising.bayern.de lra-freising.bayern.de]| map=Bavaria fs.png }} [[File:Mariendom Freising von Westen her fotografiert.jpg|thumb|[[Freising]]]] [[File:Kastulusmünsterp.jpg|thumb|[[Moosburg an der Isar|Moosburg]]]] [[File:Vorfeld Terminal 1 I.JPG|thumb|[[Munich Airport]]]] [[File:Hopfengarten-Juni.jpg|thumb|Hop garden in the [[Hallertau]]]] '''Freising''' is a district in [[Bavaria]], [[Germany]]. Following a recent ranking of the German magazine FOCUS MONEY comparing all German districts it is number one concerning economic growth abilities. It is bounded by (from the north and clockwise) the districts of [[Kelheim (district)|Kelheim]], [[Landshut (district)|Landshut]], [[Erding (district)|Erding]], [[Munich (district)|Munich]], [[Dachau (district)|Dachau]] and [[Pfaffenhofen (district)|Pfaffenhofen]]. The district is located north of the [[Munich]] metropolitan area. The [[Isar]] and [[Amper]] rivers run in parallel from southwest to northeast. North of the rivers there is the [[Hallertau]], a hilly region mainly used for [[hops|hop]] growing. ==History== In the [[Holy Roman Empire]], Freising was a clerical state ruled by the bishops. In 1803, when the clerical states of Germany were dissolved, the region was annexed by Bavaria. ==Coat of arms== {| |- valign=top ||[[File:Wappen Landkreis Freising.png|100px|Coat of arms]] ||The coat of arms displays: * the blue and white checked pattern of Bavaria * the rose from the arms of the medieval county of [[Moosburg]] * The "Freising Moor's head" |} ===The Freising Moor's head=== This is a controversial [[charge (heraldry)|charge]] in the [[Coat of Arms]], which could represent one of many different persons: * One of the three [[Biblical Magi|Magi]] (one of them is shown as a moor) * Saints who were, or probably were, moors ** [[Saint Maurice|St. Mauritius]] ** [[St. Zeno]] ** [[St. Sigismund]] (mixed up with St. Mauritius) * [[Corbinian|St. Corbinian]], who was not a moor, but whose pictures might have become darker over time. * Other person or meaning lost in time It is important to note the crown on the [[Maure|moor's head]], which probably indicated that the territory of the Bishop of Freising was autonomous. ==Towns and municipalities== {| ! align=left width=33%|Towns ! align=left width=33%|Municipalities ! align=left width=33%| |- valign=top || #[[Freising]] #[[Moosburg]] || #[[Allershausen]] #[[Attenkirchen]] #[[Au in der Hallertau]] #[[Eching, Freising|Eching]] #[[Fahrenzhausen]] #[[Gammelsdorf]] #[[Haag an der Amper]] #[[Hallbergmoos]] #[[Hohenkammer]] #[[Hörgertshausen]] #[[Kirchdorf an der Amper]] || <ol start=12> <li> [[Kranzberg]] <li> [[Langenbach, Bavaria|Langenbach]] <li> [[Marzling]] <li> [[Mauern]] <li> [[Nandlstadt]] <li> [[Neufahrn bei Freising]] <li> [[Paunzhausen]] <li> [[Rudelzhausen]] <li> [[Wang, Bavaria|Wang]] <li> [[Wolfersdorf]] <li> [[Zolling]] </ol> |} ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== {{Portal|Bavaria}} *{{commons category-inline|Landkreis Freising}} *[http://www.lra-freising.bayern.de Official website] (German) *[http://fotw.fivestarflags.com/de-by-fs.html#moo Freising County Flag] {{Germany_districts_bavaria}} {{Coord|48.5|11.83|display=title|format=dms}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Freising (District)}} [[Category:Districts of Bavaria]] [[Category:Freising (district)| ]]
